function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"High density of shoppers in supermarkets during a pandemic","Impact":"Increased risk of contagious disease propagation, potential for economic losses, and strain on health care systems","Mitigation":"Inclusion of half aisles, removable shelving, and increased aisle spacing in supermarket designs","Technologies":"Flexible shelving systems, modular aisle structures, and automated crowd monitoring systems","People":"Shoppers, supermarket employees, and the general public","Owner":"Supermarket owners, architects, and developers"},{"Description":"Lack of resilience in newly built dwellings against future pandemics","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission within residential spaces, potential for widespread outbreaks, and strain on health care systems","Mitigation":"Formal inclusion of pandemic-resilient design features in new dwellings, such as ventilation systems, flexible room layouts, and antimicrobial surfaces","Technologies":"Smart ventilation and air filtration systems, adaptive room dividers, and antimicrobial coatings","People":"Future homeowners, residents, and the general public","Owner":"Developers, architects, and regulatory bodies"},{"Description":"Fragility of the built environment in the face of contagious diseases","Impact":"Significant human cost, including loss of life, health impacts, and economic burdens on individuals and societies","Mitigation":"Investment in resilient, adaptable building designs, pandemic-aware urban planning, and enhanced public health infrastructure","Technologies":"Adaptive building materials, urban modeling software, and integrated public health surveillance systems","People":"General public, urban planners, and public health agencies","Owner":"Governments, urban development agencies, and public health organizations"}]}
